citeinfo.title: HERE 2020 Q3 Guidance Association Table for: Southern Caribbean in File Geodatabase Format

descript.abstract: The GuidanceAssociation layer defines associations relevant for Junction and Passing guidance. The Guidance Association defines an approach direction into the Junction, the landmark relevant for Guidance, and specific attribution related to this landmark.
descript.purpose: Road network navigation and routing, geocoding, location-based services, and base mapping applications.

idinfo.accconst: Access to this data is allowed only to HERE customers, as detailed specifically in HERE licensing terms and agreements.
idinfo.useconst: Use of this data is allowed only to HERE customers, as detailed specifically in HERE licensing terms and agreements.
idinfo.datacred: HERE incorporates and enhances data from a number of local governments, utility companies, other public agencies, and commercial mapping agencies in building its final products.

attracc.attraccr: HERE advanced map-building capabilities, local field staff and a fleet of LIDAR equipped TRUE vehicles capture the world down to centimeter level precision to build a virtual 3D model of the real world. In addition, internal test applications are regularly run on attributes to assist in verification and correction.

dataqual.logic: HERE publishes Technical Notification Memorandums (TNM) for customers on a quarterly and weekly basis via HERE TNM Web Portal. These TNMs include information pertaining to product updates, format changes, new attributes, detailed attribute specifications and representations, and new country coverage announcements. If HERE plans to add, remove, or change an attribute or product Layer, an announcement is made to customers a minimum of 6 months in advance. This allows customers to prepare and make necessary modifications to their applications before a new attribute is released in the product.
dataqual.complete: HERE includes 4 levels of street map coverage: Prime, Complete, Network, and City-to-City. Prime is HERE's highest level of coverage. This coverage level has the most detail and enables door-to-door routing functionality. Complete is a level of coverage, which is source dependent. It is the coverage level used for links that are not field verified and are flagged with the In-Process Data attribute = Y. Network coverage includes the main highway network and all the necessary attributes required to allow routing from city to city. Network links are coded with Detailed City Inclusion attribute = N and In-Process Data attribute = N. For Network links, the Full Geometry flag may be set to either yes or no depending on the presence or lack of surrounding In-Process Data Coverage. The City-to-City specification enables HERE to maintain minimum coverage in areas prior to completing Prime, Network, or In- Process areas. Examples include: major roads only in a country where there is no existing coverage, major roads to a city in a country where there is currently no other existing coverage, or major roads between existing DC/Prime, IT/Network, or In-Process areas. In many countries, HERE has used a commercial source to add local roads to the Inter-Town network. The inclusion of this geometry allows improved map display and guidance. This coverage level is called Full Coverage in the U.S. and Road Network Coverage in Europe. The Connector Specification enables HERE to maintain minimum coverage in areas prior to completing (full) Prime, Network/Inter Town (IT), or In-Process areas. For defining a hierarchical network used to determine a logical and efficient route for a traveler, each map street segment is tagged with a 5 level Functional Class (FC) attribute explained as follows. FC 1: Very long distance routes between major cities - The "highest level" network comprises the FC 1 arterials, which are primarily controlled access highways designed for very-long-distance travel linking major metropolitan areas and cities, FC 2: Primary routes between major and smaller cities and through metro areas, FC 3: Major routes between minor cities or towns, and through city districts, FC 4: Routes connecting minor towns or villages and collecting the local traffic in the city districts, and FC 5: Roads that are not efficient through routes - The "lowest level" and final category is FC 5, which comprises roads not considered to be arterials or transportation corridors.

horizpa.horizpar: There is no positional accuracy directly associated with non-geometric tables.

procstep.procdesc: HERE File Geodatabase Plus is assembled from the following data sources: HERE North America FGDB, HERE Traffic Patterns, HERE Postal Code Boundaries, and HERE enhanced network routing and geocoding data entities and locators.

Using proprietary tools and processes, HERE collects road geometry and approximately 400 road attributes. Proprietary software is used to add navigable information, addresses, and points of interest. TRUE vehicles and photos capture overhead signage to ensure that the data accurately reflects the real world.

HERE relies on local source data and input from map users to generate constant daily map updates, such as real time traffic, turn by turn directions, public transportation routes and information about local business and attractions.
HERE allows end users to update map content through the HERE Map Creator program, which provides online cartographic and data editing capabilities (https://mapcreator.here.com).

enttyp.enttypd: The GuidanceAssociation layer defines associations relevant for Junction and Passing guidance. The Guidance Association defines an approach direction into the Junction, the landmark relevant for Guidance, and specific attribution related to this landmark.

attrdomv.udom: The set of all OBJECTID values

attr.attrdef: Association ID - Association ID identifies the POIs involved in the association. Association ID is used to group together POIs belonging to the same association.

attrdomv.udom: The set of all ASSOCIATION_ID values

attr.attrdef: Association Type - Association Type identifies the type of relationship that exists between POIs involved in a POI Association. Association Type can be used for map display and destination selection to inform a user that a relationship between specific POIs exists.
Link ID - Unique identifier for the Link to which the Street Address relates. Link ID is used to identify each link in the database.

attrdomv.udom: The set of all LINK_ID values

attr.attrdef: Direction - Direction is a general condition modifier used for select single-link conditions that indicates the link direction for which a direction-dependent attribute is applicable. Direction is a sub-attribute to direction dependent condition coding. Direction can be used to retrieve the link direction for which the No Overtaking and Protected Overtaking condition applies.

Calculated Importance - The Calculated Importance attribute is a rating on the scale of 0 to10 of the importance of a Feature for route guidance. The higher the rating, the more relevant the Feature is for route guidance. The value is calculated based on the other Natural Guidance attributes. The Calculated Importance can be used to determine the relevance of a Feature for route guidance. When multiple Features are relevant for a manoeuvre, the Feature with the highest Calculated Importance can be selected. The Calculated Importance is published for use by those customers that do not want to interpret the individual sub-attributes of the Importance Indicator attributes themselves.

attrdomv.udom: The set of all CALCULATED_IMPORTANCE values

attr.attrdef: Visibility - The Visibility attribute defines the visibility of the Feature, from the direction of the associated link. The Visibility attribute defines the visibility of the Feature, from the direction of the associated link and can be used to determine the relevance of a Feature for route guidance. Only used for Natural Guidance.

Seasonal Dependency - The Seasonal Dependency attribute indicates whether the importance of a Feature is (negatively) impacted during a specific time period. The Seasonal Dependency attribute defines the type of restriction, the actual Time Period is mandatory. The Seasonal Dependency attribute can be used to determine the relevance of a Feature for route guidance related to the season of the year, limited to a certain time of year. Only used for Natural Guidance.

attrdomv.udom: The set of all SEASONAL_DEPENDENCY values

attr.attrdef: Relative Distance - The Relative Distance attribute indicates the perceived distance between the Feature and the guidance location. The Relative Distance attribute can be used to determine the relevance of a Feature for route guidance, and if needed to generate an advice specific to the situation. Only used for Natural Guidance.

edom.edomvd: RELATIVE CLOSE TO THE GUIDANCE LOCATION

attr.attrdef: POI ID - Unique ID for the POI.

attrdomv.udom: The set of all POI_ID values

attr.attrdef: Polygon ID - Unique identifier for polygon features. Polygon ID can be used to locate all links making up a given polygon. That information, in conjunction with the Side Inclusion for each link in the Feature Name, can be used to build polygons for map display.

attrdomv.udom: The set of all POLYGON_ID values

attr.attrdef: Aggregation ID - Aggregation ID is a unique identifier for the Aggregated Feature.

attrdomv.udom: The set of all AGGR_ID values

attr.attrdef: Feature Extent - Provides the distance of visibility for an associated feature from the point where the feature becomes visible to the decision point represented by the Junction Guidance point or the Passing Guidance point. Feature Extent contributes to the overall Calculated Importance score of a Guidance Feature.

attrdomv.udom: The set of all FEATURE_EXTENT values

attr.attrdef: Permanence - Provides a level representing the probable permanence of a feature. Permanence contributes to the overall Calculated Importance of a Guidance Feature.

distinfo.resdesc: HERE product file, multi-zip file packages in ESRI File Geodatabase format.
distinfo.distliab: This data can only be distributed to HERE customers, as detailed specifically in our licensing terms and agreements.

networka.networkr: https://HERE.flexnetoperations.com. requiring username and password as issued to customer by HERE. Immediate, easy, and secure download access for data and documentation through HERE's B2B website is the data delivery method. HERE customers also receive email notification when new releases or updates become available for data and documentation.

stdorder.fees: Contact Sales for most current pricing information.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
